    Jiho Shin

    AI/ML for Software Engineering — agentic code generation, automated testing, and reliable LLMs.

    Postdoctoral Research Fellow (Queen’s University, 2025–) and Ph.D. candidate (York University, 2021–2025) working on AI/ML for Software Engineering: agentic code/test generation, LLM reliability, and software assurance for ML systems.

    Experience Publications Awards GitHub LinkedIn Google Scholar

    Based in Kingston, ON, Canada

    • Postdoctoral Fellow at Queen’s University — Agentic SE research and advising at SAIL/MCIS.
    • Ph.D. candidate at York University — AI/ML for SE, code/test generation, LLM reliability.
    • Email: jiho.shin [at] queens.ca

    Focus areas

    Agentic SE

    Code & Test Generation

    Designing agents that synthesize code, tests, and repairs from repository signals with execution feedback.

    LLM Reliability

    Evaluation & Safety

    Benchmarking LLMs for code intelligence, vulnerability detection, and neural test oracle quality.

    SE for AI

    Assurance for ML/LLM

    Testing, validating, and hardening ML/DL libraries and AI workflows used in production software.

    Current roles

    Research

    Queen’s University — Postdoctoral Fellow

    Advising graduate researchers and leading agentic SE studies at SAIL/MCIS Lab.

    Industry

    Turing — RLEF/CodeGenAgent Lead

    Built CoT code data for reinforcement learning with execution feedback and strengthened test-generation agents.

    Selected work

    • Retrieval-Augmented Test Generation: How Far Are We? — ICSE 2026 (to appear).
    • Prompt Engineering or Fine-Tuning: An Empirical Assessment of LLMs for Code — MSR 2025.
    • Assessing Evaluation Metrics for Neural Test Oracle Generation — TSE 2024 (ICSE-JF’25).
    • Domain Adaptation for Code Model-based Unit Test Case Generation — ISSTA 2024.

    See the full list in Publications.
